instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT? PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT is a 0.75v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state .
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message:
battery dead
3.3v was going up and down, now is not
replaced, <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR> <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR>, <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>
previous short on pp5vs5-fixed, pp5vs4-fixed, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0.6v to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7831</CAPACITOR>


<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>  0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> NT
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 0.135
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.008
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.61
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>   14.51
PPVCORE GPU  0
PPVCORE S0 CPU  0
<SIGNAL>PPVTTDDR_S3</SIGNAL> 0.1 
<SIGNAL>PP0V75_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL>  0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.329
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 0.091
 <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0.053
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0.022
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> 3.328

no corrosion anywhere that hasnt been replaced, ultrasonicd and alcohol bath, 3-5 day wait, I dont need a spoon fed answer just a poke with a stick

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> NA"
What means NA???

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.008"
That means you have some voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...

Is there light on MagSafe?
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> at least.

BTW, why did you bother measuring voltages on CPU and DDR suplies, when <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> is missing?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message: PPDCIN at 14.5V also suggests you are using a 45W charger. An 85W one will be 20V.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message: Yes i am, im currently using my personal charger which is from an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, I thought it would still boot but would crash under load?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message: Only use an 85W charger for testing. 15" machines will not power on from anything else.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> drop/water damage
threads.message: Thanks mate, I will buy one asap and update after

threads.message: Buy an original, no Chinese garbage!
